title: Equilibrium Position - Box-spring compare a1 vs a2

content.question: Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="a sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="a sub 2" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>a</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="a sub 1 equals a sub 2, which equals 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>
<math alttext="a sub 1 equals a sub 2, which is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>
<math alttext="a sub 1 is greater than a sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="a sub 2 is greater than a sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="a sub 1 equals a sub 2, which equals 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
